subject: Re: [junit] NoSuchMethodError running from Ant
msgSnippet: Aha. My first note wasn t very helpful. I hadn t read this one yet. Open the ant.bat script and dump the classpath. JUnit is in there somewhere... ... J. B.
messageBody:
Aha. My first note wasn't very helpful. I hadn't read this one yet.

Open the ant.bat script and dump the classpath. JUnit is in there somewhere...

>So said craigsdickson on 4/17/2003 --------------------
>Anyone know what might cause this? I am on Ant 1.5.2, JUnit 3.8.1 and
>JDK 1.4.1. It would appear as if there are some old JUnit classes
>being used during the ant exection, but I dont know where they are
>coming from.
>
>Here is the stack trace.
>
> [junit] java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: junit.framework.TestCase.name
>()Ljava/lang/String;
> [junit] at
>org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.XMLJUnitResultFormatter.s
>tartTest(XMLJUnitResultFormatte
>r.java:186)
> [junit] at junit.framework.TestResult.startTest
>(TestResult.java:151)
> [junit] at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:103)
> [junit] at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:118)
> [junit] at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest
>(TestSuite.java:208)
> [junit] at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
> [junit] at
>org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.run
>(JUnitTestRunner.java:231)
> [junit] at
>org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.main
>(JUnitTestRunner.java:409)
> [junit] Exception in thread "main"
>
>BUILD FAILED
>
